pr_title: Remove dependency on metrics from sdk:all

timeline.message: Remove dependency on metrics from sdk:all

timeline.author: Oberon00
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -25,6 +24,7 @@ dependencies {
     testImplementation project(':sdk:testing')
     testImplementation libraries.junit_pioneer
 
+    jmh(project(':sdk:metrics'))

timeline.bodyText: If we have testing depend on metrics, we need to give it an alpha version number.
timeline.author: Oberon00
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -9,6 +9,7 @@ ext.moduleName = 'io.opentelemetry.sdk.testing'
 dependencies {
     api project(':api:all')
     api project(':sdk:all')
+    api project(':sdk:metrics')

replies.bodyText: Yeah - presumably we have many extensions we'll need to give alpha too (logging for example). Let me try addressing that more generically outside this PR.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: I don't think we have a requirement of testing artifact stability, do we? [not that I care too much if the testing artifact is versioned alpha, really]
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: This needs only implementation dependency not api correct?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -10,7 +10,7 @@ description = 'OpenTelemetry Protocol Trace Exporter'
 ext.moduleName = "io.opentelemetry.exporter.otlp.trace"
 
 dependencies {
-    api project(':sdk:all')
+    api project(':sdk:trace')

replies.bodyText: Actually it could be runtime dependency in this case.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: since the exporter implements an interface in the sdk:trace module, it effectively exposes that dependency as a part of it's API surface, so this has to be an api dependency, I believe.
replies.author: jkwatson
